babysign.description: The baby sign (and real sign language sign) for 'thank you':  touching two fingers to the chin.
babysign.title: Babysign

climb.description: He's got superb motor skills and no concept of personal safety.
climb.title: Climb

lake1.description: Dean and Felix rented a motorboat on San Pablo reservoir.
lake1.title: Lake 1

lake2.description: We went all over the reservoir, looking for the pipe that takes water to houses.
lake2.title: Lake 2

lake3.description: For a few months he's been saying he'll be a boat captain when he grows up.  He got a few seconds at the helm but was a bit overwhelmed.
lake3.title: Lake 3

party3.description: Looking down the business end of a slide.
party3.title: Party 3

walk1.description: Milo, we are proud to say, is walking.
walk1.title: Walk 1

walk2.description: It started on Sunday, all of a sudden.  He had walked a bit two Sundays before but hadn't shown an interest since.   But he must have been practicing behind our back, because now he can walk a few steps, stop and pick something heavy up, and keep going for a few more.
walk2.title: Walk 2

description:
Milo can walk! He can take more than five steps at a time, and seems very confident of himself. He usually ends his walks in a fairly controlled lowering to all fours, rather than crashing.

Felix has had some good days at his new school, but he misses Jasper a lot. We hear that Jasper misses Felix even more, and doesn't like school at all anymore. We got them together twice over the weekend. One time he insisted on picking a bouquet of flowers for Jasper, then said it was "for both of us, because we love each other so much."

New baby signs this week:
  • [smacking lips]: food.
  • [steering wheel motion]: vehicle.
He's very clearly trying to talk. Sometimes we'll say something and he'll imitate the exact intonation, if not the right sounds. And we think he's said Milo, mine, thank you, and bye-bye.
title: July 10
